title: Voyage of Light
subtitle: How light reveals the universe
description: Trace auroras, prisms, and telescopes in a cinematic journey through color and cosmos.

pages.title: Step into the Aurora
body: You arrive beneath a sky draped in shimmering curtains of color.
Scroll to trace light's path—from atoms to galaxies.

pages.title: Bending Through Glass
body: Refraction slows light as it crosses into denser mediums, bending its path and splitting color.
Every rainbow is a spectrum unwound.
pages.emphasis: Fun fact: The refractive index of diamond is 2.42—why it sparkles so intensely.

pages.title: Light's Breakthroughs
body: Moments when light reshaped our understanding.

timeline.title: 1666 — Newton
timeline.subtitle: Spectrum revealed
timeline.description: Newton used a prism to split sunlight, proving white light carries every hue.

timeline.title: 1801 — Young
timeline.subtitle: Interference
timeline.description: Thomas Young's double-slit experiment showed light behaving like a wave.

timeline.title: 1905 — Einstein
timeline.subtitle: Photoelectric
timeline.description: Einstein explained how photons kick electrons free, ushering in quantum theory.

timeline.title: 1995 — LIGO
timeline.subtitle: Interferometry
timeline.description: Laser interferometers detected ripples in spacetime—gravitational waves from colliding black holes.

pages.title: Light Across the Cosmos
body: Galaxies whisper through photons stretched by expansion.
Telescopes listen—mapping what our eyes cannot.

pages.title: Curate Your Own Light Trail
body: Remix this story with your media—change themes, swap chapters, and guide your audience.
All content is driven by a simple JSON file: update, refresh, and explore.
